title: Redistricting Battles Brewing Nationwide - This Week on Capitol Hill - 8-23-2025
description: REDISTRICTING BATTLES BREWING NATIONWIDE:  Guest host JODY HICE is Senior Fellow at the Family Research Council and served for 8 years as U.S. Representative in Georgia’s 10th Congressional District…making him ideally suited to tackle the Texas and California battles over Congressional redistricting for 2026: Congressman RANDY WEBER (R-TX) joins us to zero-in on why Texas’s need for new maps differs from “grandstanding” by California Governor GAVIN NEWSOM. Newsmax chief White House correspondent JAMES ROSEN will delve into Friday morning’s FBI raid on the home of former U.N. Ambassador JOHN BOLTON. Brigadier General JOHN TEICHERT breaks down the latest developments in the Ukraine/Russia war; former Trump administration Deputy National Security Director VICTORIA COATES looks at what’s next in the Israel/Gaza conflict; TONY PERKINS’ commentary supports President DONALD J. TRUMP’s call for a mid-decade Census which will ONLY count people who are LEGAL residents of the United States. All that ahead on Salem’s THIS WEEK ON CAPITOL HILL, sponsored by AARP, releasing at 10AM Eastern Saturday on the Salem News Channel.

summary:
This Week on Capitol Hill, featuring guest host J. J. B. Hice, a Senior Fellow at the Family Research Council, discusses the ongoing battles between Texas and California over Congressional redistricting for 2026. The panel also discusses the FBI raid on the home of former U.N. Ambassador Johnathanathan.
.
shortSummary: This week's episode of This Week on Capitol Hill discusses the ongoing debate on congressional redistricting, Israel/Russia conflicts, and the upcoming mid-decade Census.
argos_summary: Salem News Channel’s ‘This Week on Capitol Hill’ features a lineup of guests discussing national political issues. The program includes Jody Hice and Congressman Randy Weber on redistricting in Texas and California, James Rosen on an FBI raid of former U.N. Ambassador John Bolton’s home, and military and policy experts on the Ukraine‑Russia war and the Israel‑Gaza conflict. Former Trump officials Tony Perkins and Victoria Coates weigh in on Trump’s mid‑decade census proposal and the broader implications for U.S. politics.
